|-------|-----|-------|
| Web Search Results |  | To integrate a Solana wallet adapter into your website's navigation bar with a glassmorphic design, follow these steps:<br/><br/>1. **Confirm the Wallet Adapter in Use**: The Solana Wallet Adapter (SWA) is a widely adopted solution for connecting decentralized applications (dApps) to various Solana wallets. It offers extensive UI customization options and ensures compatibility with major Solana wallets. ([docs-wallet.magiceden.io](https://docs-wallet.magiceden.io/solana/solana-wallet-adapter?utm_source=openai))<br/><br/>2. **Install Necessary Packages**: Begin by installing the core SWA packages along with the React UI components:<br/><br/>   ```bash<br/>   npm install --save @solana/wallet-adapter-base @solana/wallet-adapter-react @solana/wallet-adapter-react-ui<br/>   ```<br/><br/><br/>3. **Set Up the Wallet Provider**: Create a `SolanaProvider` component to manage the connection to the Solana blockchain and handle wallet interactions:<br/><br/>   ```jsx<br/>   import \{ ConnectionProvider, WalletProvider \} from '@solana/wallet-adapter-react';<br/>   import \{ WalletModalProvider \} from '@solana/wallet-adapter-react-ui';<br/>   import \{ useMemo, useCallback \} from 'react';<br/>   import \{ clusterApiUrl \} from '@solana/web3.js';<br/><br/>   const SolanaProvider = (\{ children \}) => \{<br/>     const endpoint = clusterApiUrl('mainnet-beta');<br/>     const wallets = useMemo(() => [], []);<br/>     const onError = useCallback((error) => \{<br/>       console.error(error);<br/>     \}, []);<br/><br/>     return (<br/>       <ConnectionProvider endpoint=\{endpoint\}><br/>         <WalletProvider wallets=\{wallets\} onError=\{onError\} autoConnect><br/>           <WalletModalProvider>\{children\}</WalletModalProvider><br/>         </WalletProvider><br/>       </ConnectionProvider><br/>     );<br/>   \};<br/><br/>   export default SolanaProvider;<br/>   ```<br/><br/><br/>4. **Integrate the Wallet Button into the Navbar**: Within your navigation bar component, include the `WalletMultiButton` provided by SWA:<br/><br/>   ```jsx<br/>   import \{ WalletMultiButton \} from '@solana/wallet-adapter-react-ui';<br/><br/>   const Navbar = () => \{<br/>     return (<br/>       <nav><br/>         \{/* Other navigation items */\}<br/>         <WalletMultiButton /><br/>       </nav><br/>     );<br/>   \};<br/><br/>   export default Navbar;<br/>   ```<br/><br/><br/>5. **Apply Glassmorphic Styling**: To achieve a glassmorphic appearance for the wallet button, add the following CSS styles:<br/><br/>   ```css<br/>   .wallet-adapter-button \{<br/>     background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);<br/>     border-radius: 16px;<br/>     box-shadow: 0 4px 30px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);<br/>     backdrop-filter: blur(10px);<br/>     -webkit-backdrop-filter: blur(10px);<br/>     border: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.3);<br/>     color: #fff;<br/>     padding: 10px 20px;<br/>     font-size: 16px;<br/>     cursor: pointer;<br/>     transition: background 0.3s ease;<br/>   \}<br/><br/>   .wallet-adapter-button:hover \{<br/>     background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.3);<br/>   \}<br/>   ```<br/><br/><br/>   Ensure that this CSS is included in your project's stylesheet.<br/><br/>6. **Wrap Your Application with the Provider**: Finally, wrap your main application component with the `SolanaProvider` to provide the necessary context:<br/><br/>   ```jsx<br/>   import SolanaProvider from './SolanaProvider';<br/>   import Navbar from './Navbar';<br/><br/>   const App = () => \{<br/>     return (<br/>       <SolanaProvider><br/>         <Navbar /><br/>         \{/* Other components */\}<br/>       </SolanaProvider><br/>     );<br/>   \};<br/><br/>   export default App;<br/>   ```<br/><br/><br/>By following these steps, you'll integrate the Solana Wallet Adapter into your navigation bar with a sleek glassmorphic design, enhancing both functionality and aesthetics. |

</details>

+ &quot;use client&quot;
+ 
+ import { useWalletUi } from &quot;@wallet-ui/react&quot;
+ import { WalletUiModal, WalletUiModalTrigger, useBaseModal } from &quot;@wallet-ui/react&quot;
+ import { Wallet, LogOut } from &quot;lucide-react&quot;
+ import { cn } from &quot;@/lib/utils&quot;
+ 
+ export default function WalletButton() {
+   const { connected, account, wallet, wallets, connect, disconnect } = useWalletUi()
+   const modal = useBaseModal()
+ 
+   const handleDisconnect = () =&gt; {
+     disconnect()
+     modal.close()
+   }
+ 
+   // Format address for display
+   const formatAddress = (address: string) =&gt; {
+     return &#96;${address.slice(0, 4)}...${address.slice(-4)}&#96;
+   }
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;&gt;
+       &lt;div className=&quot;relative&quot;&gt;
+         {/* Glassomorphic glow effect */}
+         &lt;div className=&quot;absolute inset-0 bg-gradient-to-r from-cyan-500/20 to-purple-500/20 rounded-full blur-xl opacity-50&quot; /&gt;
+         
+         {connected &amp;&amp; account ? (
+           &lt;div className=&quot;relative flex items-center gap-2&quot;&gt;
+             {/* Connected state - show wallet info */}
+             &lt;button
+               onClick={modal.open}
+               className={cn(
+                 &quot;relative flex items-center gap-2 rounded-full&quot;,
+                 &quot;border border-cyan-500/30 bg-gradient-to-r from-cyan-500/10 to-purple-500/10&quot;,
+                 &quot;px-4 py-2 text-sm font-medium text-white&quot;,
+                 &quot;transition-all duration-300&quot;,
+                 &quot;hover:from-cyan-500/20 hover:to-purple-500/20&quot;,
+                 &quot;backdrop-blur-md&quot;,
+                 &quot;shadow-lg shadow-cyan-500/10&quot;
+               )}
+             &gt;
+               &lt;div className=&quot;flex items-center gap-2&quot;&gt;
+                 &lt;div className=&quot;w-2 h-2 rounded-full bg-green-400 animate-pulse&quot; /&gt;
+                 &lt;span className=&quot;hidden sm:inline&quot;&gt;
+                   {formatAddress(account.address)}
+                 &lt;/span&gt;
+                 &lt;span className=&quot;sm:hidden&quot;&gt;
+                   {formatAddress(account.address)}
+                 &lt;/span&gt;
+               &lt;/div&gt;
+             &lt;/button&gt;
+             
+             {/* Disconnect button */}
+             &lt;button
+               onClick={handleDisconnect}
+               className={cn(
+                 &quot;relative flex items-center justify-center rounded-full&quot;,
+                 &quot;border border-red-500/30 bg-red-500/10&quot;,
+                 &quot;p-2 text-sm font-medium text-white&quot;,
+                 &quot;transition-all duration-300&quot;,
+                 &quot;hover:bg-red-500/20&quot;,
+                 &quot;backdrop-blur-md&quot;,
+                 &quot;shadow-lg shadow-red-500/10&quot;
+               )}
+               title=&quot;Disconnect wallet&quot;
+             &gt;
+               &lt;LogOut className=&quot;w-4 h-4&quot; /&gt;
+             &lt;/button&gt;
+           &lt;/div&gt;
+         ) : (
+           &lt;WalletUiModalTrigger
+             modal={modal}
+             label=&quot;Connect Wallet&quot;
+             className={cn(
+               &quot;relative flex items-center gap-2 rounded-full&quot;,
+               &quot;border border-cyan-500/30 bg-gradient-to-r from-cyan-500/10 to-purple-500/10&quot;,
+               &quot;px-5 py-2.5 text-sm font-medium text-white&quot;,
+               &quot;transition-all duration-300&quot;,
+               &quot;hover:from-cyan-500/20 hover:to-purple-500/20&quot;,
+               &quot;backdrop-blur-md&quot;,
+               &quot;shadow-lg shadow-cyan-500/10&quot;
+             )}
+             leftSection={&lt;Wallet className=&quot;w-4 h-4&quot; /&gt;}
+           /&gt;
+         )}
+       &lt;/div&gt;
+ 
+       {/* Wallet selection modal */}
+       &lt;WalletUiModal
+         modal={modal}
+         wallets={wallets}
+         select={async (account) =&gt; {
+           await connect(account)
+           modal.close()
+         }}
+       /&gt;
+     &lt;/&gt;
+   )
+ }
+

## Confirmation: Wallet Adapter in Use

You're using `@wallet-ui/react` (version 2.0.0), not the standard `@solana/wallet-adapter-react`. This library provides:
- `WalletUi` provider component
- `useWalletUi()` hook for wallet state
- `WalletUiModal` and `WalletUiModalTrigger` for wallet selection
- Support for multiple Solana clusters (devnet, localnet configured)

## What I've Implemented

1. Created `WalletButton.tsx` with:
   - Glassmorphic styling (backdrop-blur, semi-transparent gradients, glow effects)
   - Connect/Disconnect functionality
   - Address display (truncated format)
   - Responsive design for mobile and desktop
   - Matches the navbar's cyan/purple gradient theme

2. Integrated into the Navbar:
   - Desktop: wallet button on the right side
   - Mobile: wallet button in the header and mobile menu

The wallet button features:
- Glassmorphic effect with `backdrop-blur-md` and gradient backgrounds
- Cyan/purple gradient matching your navbar theme
- Smooth transitions and hover effects
- Connected state indicator with animated pulse
- Disconnect button with red accent

The component is ready to use. The wallet adapter is configured in your `SolanaProvider` and supports devnet and localnet clusters.

"use client"

import { useWalletUi } from "@wallet-ui/react"
import { WalletUiModal, WalletUiModalTrigger, useBaseModal } from "@wallet-ui/react"
import { Wallet, LogOut } from "lucide-react"
import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

export default function WalletButton() {
  const { connected, account, wallet, wallets, connect, disconnect } = useWalletUi()
  const modal = useBaseModal()

  const handleDisconnect = () => {
    disconnect()
    modal.close()
  }

  // Format address for display
  const formatAddress = (address: string) => {
    return `${address.slice(0, 4)}...${address.slice(-4)}`
  }

  return (
    <>
      <div className="relative">
        {/* Glassomorphic glow effect */}
        <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-gradient-to-r from-cyan-500/20 to-purple-500/20 rounded-full blur-xl opacity-50" />
        
        {connected && account ? (
          <div className="relative flex items-center gap-2">
            {/* Connected state - show wallet info */}
            <button
              onClick={modal.open}
              className={cn(
                "relative flex items-center gap-2 rounded-full",
                "border border-cyan-500/30 bg-gradient-to-r from-cyan-500/10 to-purple-500/10",
                "px-4 py-2 text-sm font-medium text-white",
                "transition-all duration-300",
                "hover:from-cyan-500/20 hover:to-purple-500/20",
                "backdrop-blur-md",
                "shadow-lg shadow-cyan-500/10"
              )}
            >
              <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
                <div className="w-2 h-2 rounded-full bg-green-400 animate-pulse" />
                <span className="hidden sm:inline">
                  {formatAddress(account.address)}
                </span>
                <span className="sm:hidden">
                  {formatAddress(account.address)}
                </span>
              </div>
            </button>
            
            {/* Disconnect button */}
            <button
              onClick={handleDisconnect}
              className={cn(
                "relative flex items-center justify-center rounded-full",
                "border border-red-500/30 bg-red-500/10",
                "p-2 text-sm font-medium text-white",
                "transition-all duration-300",
                "hover:bg-red-500/20",
                "backdrop-blur-md",
                "shadow-lg shadow-red-500/10"
              )}
              title="Disconnect wallet"
            >
              <LogOut className="w-4 h-4" />
            </button>
          </div>
        ) : (
          <WalletUiModalTrigger
            modal={modal}
            label="Connect Wallet"
            className={cn(
              "relative flex items-center gap-2 rounded-full",
              "border border-cyan-500/30 bg-gradient-to-r from-cyan-500/10 to-purple-500/10",
              "px-5 py-2.5 text-sm font-medium text-white",
              "transition-all duration-300",
              "hover:from-cyan-500/20 hover:to-purple-500/20",
              "backdrop-blur-md",
              "shadow-lg shadow-cyan-500/10"
            )}
            leftSection={<Wallet className="w-4 h-4" />}
          />
        )}
      </div>

      {/* Wallet selection modal */}
      <WalletUiModal
        modal={modal}
        wallets={wallets}
        select={async (account) => {
          await connect(account)
          modal.close()
        }}
      />
    </>
  )
}
EOF</summary>

"use client"

import { useWalletUi } from "@wallet-ui/react"
import { WalletUiModal, WalletUiModalTrigger, useBaseModal } from "@wallet-ui/react"
import { Wallet, LogOut } from "lucide-react"
import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

export default function WalletButton() {
  const { connected, account, wallet, wallets, connect, disconnect } = useWalletUi()
  const modal = useBaseModal()

  const handleDisconnect = () => {
    disconnect()
    modal.close()
  }

  // Format address for display
  const formatAddress = (address: string) => {
    return `${address.slice(0, 4)}...${address.slice(-4)}`
  }

  return (
    <>
      <div className="relative">
        {/* Glassomorphic glow effect */}
        <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-gradient-to-r from-cyan-500/20 to-purple-500/20 rounded-full blur-xl opacity-50" />
        
        {connected && account ? (
          <div className="relative flex items-center gap-2">
            {/* Connected state - show wallet info */}
            <button
              onClick={modal.open}
              className={cn(
                "relative flex items-center gap-2 rounded-full",
                "border border-cyan-500/30 bg-gradient-to-r from-cyan-500/10 to-purple-500/10",
                "px-4 py-2 text-sm font-medium text-white",
                "transition-all duration-300",
                "hover:from-cyan-500/20 hover:to-purple-500/20",
                "backdrop-blur-md",
                "shadow-lg shadow-cyan-500/10"
              )}
            >
              <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
                <div className="w-2 h-2 rounded-full bg-green-400 animate-pulse" />
                <span className="hidden sm:inline">
                  {formatAddress(account.address)}
                </span>
                <span className="sm:hidden">
                  {formatAddress(account.address)}
                </span>
              </div>
            </button>
            
            {/* Disconnect button */}
            <button
              onClick={handleDisconnect}
              className={cn(
                "relative flex items-center justify-center rounded-full",
                "border border-red-500/30 bg-red-500/10",
                "p-2 text-sm font-medium text-white",
                "transition-all duration-300",
                "hover:bg-red-500/20",
                "backdrop-blur-md",
                "shadow-lg shadow-red-500/10"
              )}
              title="Disconnect wallet"
            >
              <LogOut className="w-4 h-4" />
            </button>
          </div>
        ) : (
          <WalletUiModalTrigger
            modal={modal}
            label="Connect Wallet"
            className={cn(
              "relative flex items-center gap-2 rounded-full",
              "border border-cyan-500/30 bg-gradient-to-r from-cyan-500/10 to-purple-500/10",
              "px-5 py-2.5 text-sm font-medium text-white",
              "transition-all duration-300",
              "hover:from-cyan-500/20 hover:to-purple-500/20",
              "backdrop-blur-md",
              "shadow-lg shadow-cyan-500/10"
            )}
            leftSection={<Wallet className="w-4 h-4" />}
          />
        )}
      </div>

      {/* Wallet selection modal */}
      <WalletUiModal
        modal={modal}
        wallets={wallets}
        select={async (account) => {
          await connect(account)
          modal.close()
        }}
      />
    </>
  )
}
EOF
```
</details>
</tool-use>

---


The `WalletUiListButton` only calls `select` if the wallet has accounts. If the wallet isn't connected, there are no accounts, so it greys out and does nothing.

The modal should request accounts from the wallet first. The `select` callback receives an account only if the wallet already has accounts. If clicking a wallet greys it out, the wallet likely isn't connected or doesn't have accounts yet.

Check the browser console for errors. The wallet extension may need to be installed or enabled. The current implementation should work if wallets are properly connected.

Try:
1. Check the browser console for errors when clicking a wallet
2. Ensure the wallet extension (Phantom, Backpack, etc.) is installed and enabled
3. Check if the wallet needs to be unlocked/authorized

The code looks correct. The issue is likely that wallets need to be connected first to populate their accounts array. The `WalletUiModal` should handle this, but if wallets aren't detected or connected, they won't have accounts to select.

If the issue persists, we may need to add custom logic to request wallet connection before account selection.

+ 
+ // Separate component to handle wallet list with proper hook usage
+ function WalletListModal({
+   modal,
+   wallets,
+   connect,
+   connectingWallet,
+   setConnectingWallet
+ }: {
+   modal: BaseModalControl
+   wallets: UiWallet[]
+   connect: (account: UiWalletAccount) =&gt; void
+   connectingWallet: string | null
+   setConnectingWallet: (name: string | null) =&gt; void
+ }) {
+   if (!modal.api.open) return null
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;div className=&quot;fixed inset-0 z-50 flex items-center justify-center&quot;&gt;
+       &lt;div 
+         className=&quot;fixed inset-0 bg-black/80 backdrop-blur-sm&quot; 
+         onClick={() =&gt; modal.close()}
+       /&gt;
+       &lt;div className={cn(
+         &quot;relative z-50 w-full max-w-md rounded-lg border border-slate-800/50 bg-black/90&quot;,
+         &quot;backdrop-blur-md shadow-lg shadow-cyan-500/10 p-6&quot;,
+         &quot;animate-in fade-in-0 zoom-in-95&quot;
+       )}&gt;
+         &lt;div className=&quot;flex items-center justify-between mb-4&quot;&gt;
+           &lt;h2 className=&quot;text-lg font-semibold text-white&quot;&gt;Connect a wallet on Solana to continue&lt;/h2&gt;
+           &lt;button
+             onClick={() =&gt; modal.close()}
+             className=&quot;text-slate-400 hover:text-white transition-colors&quot;
+           &gt;
+             &lt;svg className=&quot;w-5 h-5&quot; fill=&quot;none&quot; stroke=&quot;currentColor&quot; viewBox=&quot;0 0 24 24&quot;&gt;
+               &lt;path strokeLinecap=&quot;round&quot; strokeLinejoin=&quot;round&quot; strokeWidth={2} d=&quot;M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12&quot; /&gt;
+             &lt;/svg&gt;
+           &lt;/button&gt;
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+         &lt;div className=&quot;space-y-2&quot;&gt;
+           {wallets.map((w) =&gt; (
+             &lt;WalletButtonItem
+               key={w.name}
+               wallet={w}
+               connect={connect}
+               connectingWallet={connectingWallet}
+               setConnectingWallet={setConnectingWallet}
+               onConnect={() =&gt; modal.close()}
+             /&gt;
+           ))}
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+       &lt;/div&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ function WalletButtonItem({
+   wallet,
+   connect,
+   connectingWallet,
+   setConnectingWallet,
+   onConnect
+ }: {
+   wallet: UiWallet
+   connect: (account: UiWalletAccount) =&gt; void
+   connectingWallet: string | null
+   setConnectingWallet: (name: string | null) =&gt; void
+   onConnect: () =&gt; void
+ }) {
+   const walletHook = useWalletUiWallet({ wallet })
+   const hasAccounts = wallet.accounts.length &gt; 0
+   const isConnecting = connectingWallet === wallet.name
+ 
+   const handleClick = async () =&gt; {
+     try {
+       setConnectingWallet(wallet.name)
+       if (!hasAccounts) {
+         // Connect wallet first to get accounts
+         const accounts = await walletHook.connect()
+         if (accounts &amp;&amp; accounts.length &gt; 0) {
+           connect(accounts[0])
+           onConnect()
+         }
+       } else {
+         // Wallet already has accounts, just connect
+         connect(wallet.accounts[0])
+         onConnect()
+       }
+     } catch (error) {
+       console.error(&#96;Error connecting ${wallet.name}:&#96;, error)
+     } finally {
+       setConnectingWallet(null)
+     }
+   }
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;button
+       disabled={isConnecting}
+       onClick={handleClick}
+       className={cn(
+         &quot;w-full flex items-center gap-3 px-4 py-3 rounded-lg&quot;,
+         &quot;border border-slate-800/50 bg-slate-900/50&quot;,
+         &quot;hover:bg-slate-800/50 transition-colors&quot;,
+         &quot;disabled:opacity-50 disabled:cursor-not-allowed&quot;,
+         isConnecting &amp;&amp; &quot;animate-pulse&quot;
+       )}
+     &gt;
+       {wallet.icon &amp;&amp; (
+         &lt;img 
+           src={wallet.icon} 
+           alt={wallet.name} 
+           className=&quot;w-6 h-6&quot;
+           onError={(e) =&gt; {
+             // Fallback if icon fails to load
+             e.currentTarget.style.display = &#39;none&#39;
+           }}
+         /&gt;
+       )}
+       &lt;span className=&quot;text-white font-medium&quot;&gt;{wallet.name}&lt;/span&gt;
+       {isConnecting &amp;&amp; (
+         &lt;span className=&quot;ml-auto text-slate-400 text-sm&quot;&gt;Connecting...&lt;/span&gt;
+       )}
+     &lt;/button&gt;
+   )
+ }
  
  
```

---



---


Fixed both issues:

1. **Dropdown animation**: Set `side="bottom"` and overrode slide-in animations to prevent the left-side slide-in.

2. **Wallet connection**: Added a custom wallet modal that handles wallets without accounts:
   - Uses `useWalletUiWallet` to connect wallets that don't have accounts yet
   - If a wallet has no accounts, it calls `walletHook.connect()` first to request accounts from the extension
   - Then connects the first account
   - If accounts already exist, it connects directly

The dropdown now drops down normally, and all wallets (not just Phantom) should work. The custom modal handles the connection flow for wallets that need to be connected first before account selection.

Fixed the mobile layout for the hero metrics section:

1. **Stacked layout on mobile**: Changed from `grid-cols-3` to `grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-3` so items stack vertically on mobile and show 3 columns on larger screens.

2. **Centered text on mobile**: Added `text-center sm:text-left` to center text on mobile and left-align on larger screens.

3. **Responsive font sizes**: 
   - Main text: `text-2xl sm:text-3xl md:text-4xl` (smaller on mobile)
   - Descriptions: `text-xs sm:text-sm` (smaller on mobile)

4. **Reduced gap on mobile**: Changed from `gap-8` to `gap-6 sm:gap-8` for better spacing on small screens.

On mobile, the metrics now stack vertically and are centered, preventing text cutoff and improving readability.

1. **Updated "Enterprise Security" card**: Removed mentions of multi-sig wallets, cold storage, and audits. Changed to: "Secure on-chain migration process with transparent operations and automated execution."

2. **Removed "50+ projects" text**: Replaced "Join 50+ projects that have successfully migrated with w3Swap" with: "Start your secure token migration journey with w3Swap. Get started today."

3. **Centered "Apply Now" button on mobile**:
   - Added `items-center` to the flex container
   - Made buttons full-width on mobile (`w-full sm:w-auto`) so they center properly
   - Both buttons are now centered on mobile and return to auto-width on larger screens

The content is now accurate for a pre-launch state, and the buttons are properly centered on mobile.

// Alternative version with more graphical elements

export function LogoGraphical({ className, size = 'md' }: LogoProps) {

  const textSize = sizeClasses[size];

  

  return (

    <div className={cn('flex items-center', className)}>

      {/* Text with enhanced styling - w3 Swap in same container */}

      <span className={cn('font-bold tracking-tight', textSize)}>

        <span className="relative inline-block">

          <span className="relative z-10">

            <span className="text-gradient-primary font-extrabold tracking-tighter">w3Swap</span>

            {/* Multiple decorative elements for w3 Swap */}

            <span className="absolute -top-1 -left-1 -right-1 -bottom-1 border border-primary-500/30 rounded-sm -z-0 blur-[1px]" />

            <span className="absolute bottom-0 left-0 right-0 h-1 bg-gradient-to-r from-transparent via-primary-500/40 to-transparent rounded-full -z-0" />

          </span>

        </span>

      </span>

    </div>

  );

}

_**User (2025-11-07 15:58Z)**_

import * as React from 'react';

import { cva, type VariantProps } from 'class-variance-authority';

import { cn } from '@/lib/utils';



const badgeVariants = cva(

  [

    'inline-flex items-center rounded-full border px-2.5 py-0.5 text-xs font-semibold',

    'transition-colors duration-200 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-ring focus:ring-offset-2',

  ],

  {

    variants: {

      variant: {

        default: [

          'border-border bg-surface text-foreground',

          'hover:bg-surface-2',

        ],

        primary: [

          'border-primary-500/20 bg-primary-500/10 text-primary-400',

          'hover:bg-primary-500/20',

        ],

        secondary: [

          'border-secondary-500/20 bg-secondary-500/10 text-secondary-400',

          'hover:bg-secondary-500/20',

        ],

        success: [

          'border-success-500/20 bg-success-500/10 text-success-400',

          'hover:bg-success-500/20',

        ],

        warning: [

          'border-warning-500/20 bg-warning-500/10 text-warning-400',

          'hover:bg-warning-500/20',

        ],

        danger: [

          'border-danger-500/20 bg-danger-500/10 text-danger-400',

          'hover:bg-danger-500/20',

        ],

        outline: [

          'border-border text-foreground',

          'hover:bg-surface',

        ],

        ghost: [

          'border-transparent text-foreground-muted',

          'hover:bg-surface hover:text-foreground',

        ],

      },

      size: {

        sm: 'px-2 py-0.5 text-xs',

        default: 'px-2.5 py-0.5 text-xs',

        lg: 'px-3 py-1 text-sm',

      },

    },

    defaultVariants: {

      variant: 'default',

      size: 'default',

    },

  }

);



export interface BadgeProps

  extends React.HTMLAttributes<HTMLDivElement>,

    VariantProps<typeof badgeVariants> {

  icon?: React.ReactNode;

}



function Badge({ className, variant, size, icon, children, ...props }: BadgeProps) {

  return (

    <div className={cn(badgeVariants({ variant, size }), className)} {...props}>

      {icon && <span className="mr-1">{icon}</span>}

      {children}

    </div>

  );

}



export { Badge, badgeVariants };

Updated the Badge component with the new version. It includes:

1. **More variants**: `default`, `primary`, `secondary`, `success`, `warning`, `danger`, `outline`, `ghost`
2. **Icon support**: Optional `icon` prop that renders before the children
3. **Updated styling**: Uses color classes like `primary-500/20`, `primary-400`, etc.
4. **Size options**: `sm`, `default`, `lg`

The component now supports icons and additional variants. The Navbar's Beta badge with `variant="primary"` and `size="sm"` should work with this update.

Note: The new Badge uses color classes like `primary-500/20` and `primary-400`. If these aren't defined in your Tailwind config, you may need to add them or adjust the classes to match your existing color system.
